intro: Cyphostemma wittei, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-yellow flowers followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing along rocky outcrops and in dry woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
